englishNarrator: Jabir bin Abdullah (رضی اللہ عنہ) reported:
hadithEnglish: We used to get land (on rent) during the lifetime of Allah's Messenger, ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) with a share of one-third or one-fourth (of the produce from the land irrigated) with the help of canals. Thereupon Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) stood up (to address) and said: HRe who has land should cultivate it, and if he does not cultivate it, he should lend it to his brother, and if he does not lend it to his brother, he should then retain it.
I heard Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) as saying: He who has (surplus) land should donate it (to others), or lend it.

englishNarrator: It was narrated from Al-Amash with this chain (a Hadith similar to no. 3926), except that he said:
hadithEnglish: "Let him cultivate it, or let his brother cultivate it."

Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) had forbidden renting of land. Bukair (one of the narrators) said: Nafi` reported to me that he heard Ibn `Umar (رضی اللہ عنہ) saying: We used to give land on rent; we then abandoned this practice when we heard the hadith of Rafi` bin Khadij رضی اللہ عنہ .
Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) forbidding the selling (renting of) uncultivated land for two years or three.

Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) forbidding selling of (produce) in advance for two years, and in the narmtion of Ibu Abd Shaiba (the words are): Selling of the fruits (on the tree) in advance for two years.

englishNarrator: Abu Huraira (Allah be pleased with him) reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) as saying: He who has land should cultivate it or lend it to his brother, but if he refuses, he should retain his land.

englishNarrator: Jabir bin Abdullah (رضی اللہ عنہ) reported:
hadithEnglish: I heard Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) forbidding Muzabana, and Huqul. Jabir bin Abdullah (رضی اللہ عنہ) said: Muzabana means the selling of fruits for dry dates and Huqul is the renting of land.
Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) forbidding Muhaqala and Muzabana.

englishNarrator: Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (رضی اللہ عنہ) reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) having forbidden Mazabana and Muhaqala. Muzibana means the buying of fruits on the trees and Muhaqala is the renting of land.

I heard Ibn Umar (رضی اللہ عنہ) say: We did not see any harm in renting of the land, but as the first year was over Rafi' رضی اللہ عنہ alleged Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) having forbidden that.

englishNarrator: This hadith has been narrated on the authority of Amr bin Dinar with the same chain of transmitters but (in) the hadith transmitted on the authority of 'Uyainah (the words are):
hadithEnglish: We abandoned it (renting) on account of that.
Rafi رضی اللہ عنہ forbade us from benefitting from our land (in the form of rent).

Ibn Umar (رضی اللہ عنہ) rented his land during the lifetime of Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) and during the caliphate of Abu Bakr and that of Umar and that of Uthman (رضی اللہ عنہ) and during the early period of Muawiya's caliphate until at the end of Muawiya's reign, it reached him (Ibn 'Umar) that Rafi bin Khadij (رضی اللہ عنہ) narratted (a hadith) in which (there was a decree) of prohibition by Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌). He (Ibn 'Umar رضی اللہ عنہ) went to him (Rafi bin Khadij رضی اللہ عنہ) and I was with him and he asked him, whereupon he said: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) used to forbid the renting of land. So Ibn Umar (رضی اللہ عنہ) abandoned it, and subsequently whenever he was asked about it, he said: Rafi bin Khadij (رضی اللہ عنہ) alleged that Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) forbade it.

englishNarrator: This hadith has been narrated on the authority of Ayyub and he made an addition in the hadith narrated by Ibn Ulayya in which he said:
hadithEnglish: Ibn Umar رضی اللہ عنہ abandoned it afterwards and he did not rent it (the land).

I went to Rafi bin Khadij رضی اللہ عنہ in the company of Ibn 'Umar (رضی اللہ عنہ) until he (Ibn 'Umar رضی اللہ عنہ) came to him at Balat (a place near Prophet's Mosque at Medina) and he (Rafi bin Khadij رضی اللہ عنہ) informed him that Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) had forbidden the renting of land.

englishNarrator: Nafi, reported from Ibn Umar ( رضی اللہ عنہ):
hadithEnglish: He came to Rafi رضی اللہ عنہ and he narrated this hadith from Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ).

Ibn Umar (رضی اللہ عنہ) used to rent the land, and that he was conveyed the hadith transmitted on the authority of Rafi bin Khadij. He (the narrator) said: He then went to him along with me. He (Rafi) narrated from some of his uncles in which it was mentioned that Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) forbade the renting of land. Ibn 'Umar (رضی اللہ عنہ) then abandoned this practice of renting.

englishNarrator: Ibn 'Awn narrated (a Hadith as no. 3942) it with this chain, and he said:
hadithEnglish: "He Rafi narrated to him from some of his paternal uncles, from the prophet ﷺ.

Abdullah bin Umar ( رضی اللہ عنہ) used to give land on rent until (this news) reached him that Rafi bin Khadij Ansari رضی اللہ عنہ used to forbid the renting of land. Abdullah رضی اللہ عنہ met him and said: Ibn Khadij, what is this that you narrate from Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) pertaining to renting of land? Rafi bin Khadij رضی اللہ عنہ said to Abdullah: I heard it from two uncles of mine and they had participated in the Battle of Badr who narrated to the members of the family that Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) forbade the renting of land. Abdullah رضی اللہ عنہ said: I knew it that the land was rented during the lifetime of Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌). Abdullah رضی اللہ عنہ then apprehended that Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) might have said something new in this connection (in regard to prohibition of renting) which I failed to know. So he abandoned the renting of land.

englishNarrator: Rafi bin Khadij (رضی اللہ عنہ) reported:
hadithEnglish: We used to give on rent land during the lifetime of Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ). We rented it on the share of one-third or one-fourth of the (produce) along with a definite quantity of corn. One day a person from among my uncles came to us and said: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) forbade us this act which was a source of benefit to us, but the obedience to Allah and to His Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) is more beneficial to us. He forbade us that we should rent land with one-third or one-fourth of (the produce) and the corn of a measure, and he commanded the owner of land that he should cultivate it or let it be cultivated by other (persons) but he showed disapproval of renting it or anything besides it.

englishNarrator: Rafi bin Khadij ( رضی اللہ عنہ ) reported:
hadithEnglish: We used to give land on rent, and we rented it on one-third or one-fourth share. The rest of the hadith is the same.
A similar report (as no. 3946) was narrated from Ya'la bin Hakim, with this chain.
This hadith has been narrated on the authority of Rafi' bin Khadij رضی اللہ عنہ with the same chain of transmitters, but in it no mention is made of some of his uncles.

Zuhair bin Rafi رضی اللہ عنہ (who was his uncle) came to me and said: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) forbade a practice which was useful for us. I said: What is this? (I believe) that whatever Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) says is absolutely true. He (Zuhair) said that he (the Holy Prophet) asked me: What do you do with your cultivable lands? I said: Allah's Messenger, we rent those irrigated by canals for dry dates or barley. He said: Don't do that. Cultivate them or let them be cultivated (by others) or retain them yourself.
